title: 36 Health & Well-Being Books That Are Must-Reads For This Year
description: For a healthier 2023, top health and well-being experts are sharing their wisdom. Here, we've rounded up the books we're most excited to read in 2023.
cleaned_text: 21 Health & Well-Being Books For Your 2023 Reading List [By Kristine Thomason](/wc/kristine-thomason) [commerce guidelines.](/commerce-guidelines)Our selections are never influenced by the commissions earned from our links. After a year as tumultuous as 2020, to say we're ready for a fresh start would be putting it lightly. At mbg, we're excited to apply all the important lessons we learned in the last 12 months and work toward a healthier, more joyful 2021. For a little extra guidance and inspiration that lasts all year long, we're turning to top health and well-being experts and the titles they're releasing throughout the year. Here, we've rounded up the books we're most excited to dive into in 2021. Advertisement Be As a kid, you were likely told to "be yourself." But in an age of social media and personal branding, that's certainly easier said than done. This book, by authenticity expert [Jessica Zweig](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/wc/jessica-zweig), offers guidance for how to feel confident as you build connections with others and sculpt a future that's authentic to you. [Be: A No-Bullsh*t Guide to Increasing Your Self Worth and Net Worth by Simply Being Yourself](https://www.amazon.com/Be-No-Bullsh-Increasing-Simply-Yourself/dp/1683646991/ref=as_li_qf_sp_asin_il_tl?tag=mind0a3-20) by Jessica Zweig (Read an excerpt about how Zweig made meditation a daily habit, [here](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/articles/meditation-forms-from-an-entrepreneur).) Biohack Your Brain With the rise of health-focused wearables, we're [predicting biohacking will be bigger than ever in 2021](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/articles/micro-tracking-health). This book further fuels that theory, as leading neuroscientist [Kristen Willeumier, Ph.D.](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/wc/kristen-willeumier-ph-d), shares ways to supercharge your brain (think boosting cognitive performance and prevent memory loss) via simple lifestyle changes. [Biohack Your Brain: How To Boost Cognitive Health, Performance & Power](https://www.amazon.com/Biohack-Your-Brain-Cognitive-Performance-ebook/dp/B086JXQ5LC/ref=as_li_qf_sp_asin_il_tl?tag=mind0a3-20) by Kristen Willeumier, Ph.D. (Read an excerpt about what to drink for better brain health, [here](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/articles/hydrating-drinks-to-benefit-brain-health-that-arent-water) and how to change your brain in 10 minutes, [here](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/articles/change-your-brain-with-these-easy-tasks).) Body Love: A Journal If you've read and loved nutritionist [Kelly Leveque](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/wc/kelly-leveque)'s bestselling books Body Love and Body Love Every Day, you'll definitely want to pick up a copy of this companion. The 90-day journal includes tools from Leveque to help apply her nutrition lessons to your own life and personalize them based on your own specific needs. What better way to kick off the new year? [Body Love: A Journal: 12 Weeks To Practice Positivity, Create Momentum, and Build Your Healthy Lifestyle](https://www.amazon.com/Body-Love-Journal-Kelly-LeVeque/dp/B002DM4I56/ref=as_li_qf_sp_asin_il_tl?tag=mind0a3-20) by Kelly Leveque (Read an excerpt about how to set healthy goals, [here](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/articles/how-to-set-health-goals-from-celebrity-nutritionist).) Advertisement Clean Mind, Clean Body We could all probably use a bit more self-care heading into the new year. In this new book by Strala Yoga founder and mbg Collective member [Tara Stiles](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/wc/tara-stiles), she outlines actionable ways to be [more present](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/articles/how-to-find-mental-flow-state-from-yoga-instructor) and [transform daily habits](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/articles/tip-for-all-day-mindfulness), all with the goal of improving mental and physical well-being. [Clean Mind, Clean Body](https://www.tarastiles.com/books) by Tara Stiles (Read an excerpt on how to make cooking at home more accessible, [here.](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/articles/kitchen-staples-to-make-cooking-more-accessible)) Cleaning Up Your Mental Mess Communication pathologist and cognitive neuroscientist [Caroline Leaf, Ph.D., BSc](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/wc/caroline-leaf-ph-d-bsc), has previously advice with mbg about [mitigating worry](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/articles/practical-tips-to-manage-worry) and [mental overload](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/articles/multitasking-brain-health). In her latest book, Leaf offers a research-backed, five-step plan to detect and eliminate the root of anxiety, depression, and intrusive thoughts. [Cleaning Up Your Mental Mess: 5 Simple, Scientifically Proven Steps To Reduce Anxiety, Stress, and Toxic Thinking](https://www.amazon.com/Cleaning-Your-Mental-Mess-Scientifically/dp/0801093457/ref=as_li_qf_sp_asin_il_tl?tag=mind0a3-20) by Caroline Leaf, Ph.D., BSc (Read an excerpt on how your negative thoughts affect others, [here](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/articles/how-your-thoughts-affect-others-from-a-neuroscientist).) Eat To Beat Depression and Anxiety The power of nutritious food once again makes its way into the spotlight in the latest book by [Drew Ramsey, M.D](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/wc/dr-drew-ramsey). In Eat To Beat Depression and Anxiety, Ramsey shares recent research on the connection between nutrition and brain health and includes a six-week food plan that features the best ingredients to simultaneously support your body and mind. [Eat To Beat Depression and Anxiety: Nourish Your Way to Better Mental Health in Six Weeks](https://www.amazon.com/Eat-Beat-Depression-Anxiety-Nourish/dp/006303171X/ref=as_li_qf_sp_asin_il_tl?tag=mind0a3-20) by Drew Ramsey, M.D. Read an excerpt on Ramsey's favorite cooking fats for brain health, [here](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/articles/brain-healthy-cooking-fats-to-keep-in-your-kitchen).) Fast This Way Bulletproof founder [Dave Asprey](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/wc/dave-asprey) was a fan of [fasting](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/articles/your-definitive-guide-to-intermittent-fasting) long before it was popularized. In this book, he reveals insight gleaned from the latest research and his own personal experiences to help both novice and seasoned intermittent fasters optimize their eating routine, based on their personal biology. [Fast This Way (How To Lose Weight, Get Smarter, and Live Your Longest, Healthiest Life With the Bulletproof Guide to Fasting)](https://www.amazon.com/Fast-This-Way-Inflammation-High-Performing/dp/0062882864/ref=as_li_qf_sp_asin_il_tl?tag=mind0a3-20) by David Asprey Read an excerpt about reverse intermittent fasting, [here](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/articles/reverse-intermittent-fasting-circadian-rhythm).) Happy Not Perfect After perhaps one of the most anxiety-ridden years in our recent history, this book by wellness founder [Poppy Jamie](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/wc/poppy-jamie) is a welcome read. In the pages, she details her work with mental health experts and researchers to uncover effective brain-rewiring strategies. Through her experience, you'll glean advice on how to be more adaptable and accepting of our very uncertain world. [Happy, Not Perfect: Upgrade Your Mind, Challenge Your Thoughts, and Free Yourself From Anxiety](https://www.penguinrandomhouse.com/books/652047/happy-not-perfect-by-poppy-jamie/) by Poppy Jamie (Read an excerpt on flexible thinking, [here](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/articles/the-power-of-flexible-thinking-how-to-put-it-into-practice).) The Energy Paradox Following his bestselling books The Plant Paradox and The Longevity Paradox, [Steven Gundry, M.D.](https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/the-mindbodygreen-podcast/id1246494475?i=1000445934048), is sharing even more valuable information on health and well-being in his latest work: The Energy Paradox. In the book, he homes in on how to increase mitochondrial energy production and nourish the microbiome; shares energy-boosting foods and recipes; and offers tools for readers to live overall healthier, more energetic lives. [The Energy Paradox: What To Do When Your Get-Up-and-Go Has Got Up and Gone](https://www.amazon.com/Energy-Paradox-Being-Tired-Finally-ebook/dp/B085NTP6DZ/ref=as_li_qf_sp_asin_il_tl?tag=mind0a3-20) by Steven Gundry, M.D. (Read an excerpt on the three Ls of chronic inflammation, [here](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/articles/three-ls-of-inflammation) and why being gassy can be a good thing, [here](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/articles/why-this-md-says-intestinal-gas-can-be-a-good-thing).) Advertisement How To Sleep There's a reason mbg has been [writing a lot about sleep](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/articles/the-14-best-sleep-tips-of-2020-from-experts)—after a tumultuous year, rest is more essential than ever. In his new book How To Sleep, expert sleep clinician Rafael Pelayo, M.D., tackles the many issues that can affect shuteye (such as snoring and insomnia) with holistic solutions. [How To Sleep: The New Science-Based Solutions for Sleeping Through the Night](https://www.amazon.com/How-Sleep-Science-Based-Solutions-Sleeping/dp/1579659578/ref=as_li_qf_sp_asin_il_tl?tag=mind0a3-20) by Rafael Pelayo, M.D. I'm So Effing Tired Based on her own wellness journey, double board-certified doctor and mbg Collective member [Amy Shah, M.D.,](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/wc/dr-amy-shah) created a program to help regain energy and take control of life—which she details in I'm So Effing Tired. In her book, Shah homes in on three critical systems in your body—gut, immunity, and hormones—and outlines how to nourish each one through what you eat, when you eat, and the ways you manage stress. [I'm So Effing Tired: A Proven Plan To Beat Burnout, Boost Your Energy, and Reclaim Your Life](https://www.amazon.com/Im-So-Effing-Tired-burnout-ebook/dp/B0899HB671/ref=as_li_qf_sp_asin_il_tl?tag=mind0a3-20) by Amy Shah, M.D. (Read an excerpt on questions to asks if you think you have a hormonal imbalance, [here](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/articles/hormone-imbalance-questions).) Intuitive Fasting Intermittent fasting and intuitive eating have become major buzz-phrases in the well-being world. Now, similar to the way he took the best of plant-based and ketogenic eating styles to form the "ketotarian diet," functional medicine expert [William Cole, IFMCP, DNM, D.C.](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/wc/william-cole-dc), has created a guide for fasting more mindfully (aka "intuitive fasting"). In his four-week flexible fasting plan, Cole guides you through various IF windows, with each week targeting a different element of your health. [Intuitive Fasting: The Flexible Four-Week Intermittent Fasting Plan To Recharge Your Metabolism and Renew Your Health](https://www.amazon.com/Intuitive-Fasting-Four-Week-Intermittent-Metabolism/dp/059323233X/ref=as_li_qf_sp_asin_il_tl?tag=mind0a3-20) by William Cole, IFMCP, DNM, D.C. (Get Cole's [veggie frittata](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/articles/veggie-frittata-with-lemon-spring-greens) and [taco cauliflower bowl](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/articles/taco-cauliflower-bowl-recipe) and read an excerpt on how to stay hydrated during a fast, [here](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/articles/electrolytes-and-fasting).) Advertisement Karma The concept of [karma](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/articles/ways-karma-from-your-past-lives-affects-you-now) is far more complex than a tally of your good and bad actions. In this guide, Sadhguru helps restore your understanding of karma and provides insight for living life more joyfully and with intention. [Karma: A Yogi's Guide To Crafting Your Destiny](https://www.amazon.com/Karma-Yogis-Guide-Crafting-Destiny-ebook/dp/B08F4GYK9P/ref=as_li_qf_sp_asin_il_tl?tag=mind0a3-20) by Sadhguru Love Your Gut [Megan Rossi, Ph.D., R.D.](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/wc/megan-rossi-ph-d-r-d), shares her top gut health insights in this new book—including everything from how your gut works to why things might be awry. The book includes a gut health quiz to help you better understand your own body; tools to support your microbiome; and 50 plant-based, gut-healthy recipes to try. [Love Your Gut: Supercharge Your Digestive Health and Transform Your From the Inside Out](https://www.amazon.com/Love-Your-Gut-Easy-Digest/dp/1615197060/ref=as_li_qf_sp_asin_il_tl?tag=mind0a3-20) by Megan Rossi Ph.D., R.D. (Read an excerpt on the nutrients you may be missing on a plant-based diet, [here](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/articles/nutrients-that-may-be-low-on-plant-based-diet-food-sources).) Metabolical At mbg, [metabolic health](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/articles/markers-of-metabolic-health) is top-of-mind as we head into 2021. That's why we're excited about this new book from neuroendocrinologist Robert Lustig, M.D., which highlights how food is the best tool we have to create biochemical change in our bodies and prevent chronic disease. [Metabolical: The Lure and the Lies of Processed Food, Nutrition, and Modern Medicine](https://www.amazon.com/Metabolical-Processed-Nutrition-Modern-Medicine/dp/0063027712/ref=as_li_qf_sp_asin_il_tl?tag=mind0a3-20) by Robert Lustig, M.D. Advertisement The 30-Day Alzheimer's Solution The daily food and lifestyle choices we make have a major impact on our overall well-being—and that applies to our brain health, too. In fact, as neurologists [Dean Sherzai, M.D., and Ayesha Sherzai, M.D.](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/wc/dean-sherzai-m-d-ph-d-and-ayesha-sherzai-m-d), point out in this book, food is the first line of defense against Alzheimer's. Based on decades of research and their own clinical experience, the husband-and-wife team created this comprehensive guide to help protect and maintain brain health. [The 30-Day Alzheimer's Solution: The Definitive Food and Lifestyle Guide to Preventing Cognitive Decline](https://www.amazon.com/30-Day-Alzheimers-Solution-Definitive-Preventing/dp/0062996959/ref=as_li_qf_sp_asin_il_tl?tag=mind0a3-20) by Dean Sherzai, M.D., and Ayesha Sherzai, M.D. (Read an excerpt on their 5-step method to support cognitive functioning, [here](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/articles/method-to-support-cognitive-function-from-neurologists).) The Art of Impossible Every new year, we strive to grow and shape even better versions of ourselves. To jump-start that goal, consider picking up a copy of bestselling author and speaker Steven Kotler's new book. It lays out how to optimize personal performance, based on the latest neuroscience research—condensed into a digestible guide. [The Art of Impossible: A Peak Performance Primer](https://www.amazon.com/Art-Impossible-Peak-Performance-Primer/dp/0062977539/ref=as_li_qf_sp_asin_il_tl?tag=mind0a3-20) by Steven Kotler The Case For Keto There are some mixed reviews when it comes to the [ketogenic diet](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/articles/what-is-the-keto-diet-how-do-you-do-it), but in this book, journalist and bestselling author Gary Taubes shares his admiration for the low-carb eating plan. Based on years of interviews with physicians who support the keto lifestyle, Taubes advocates for the diet, asserting how it may help in the fight against diabetes and obesity. [The Case for Keto: Rethinking Weight Control and the Science and Practice of Low-Carb/High-Fat Eating](https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07XXFHP9S/ref=as_li_qf_sp_asin_il_tl?tag=mind0a3-20) by Gary Taubes Chatter You may have heard about the harmful effects of negative "self-talk." In this book, psychologist [Ethan Kross, Ph.D.](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/wc/ethan-kross-ph-d), takes that one step further, and unpacks how those nasty thoughts (which he calls "chatter") can have a profound impact on our physical and mental health. What's more, he shares simple strategies to make that internal voice a positive one. [Chatter: The Voice in Our Head, Why It Matters, and How to Harness It](https://www.amazon.com/Chatter-Voice-Head-Matters-Harness-ebook/dp/B087PL8YVQ/ref=as_li_qf_sp_asin_il_tl?tag=mind0a3-20) by Ethan Kross, Ph.D. (Read an excerpt about how one woman lost her inner chatter and became liberated, [here.](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/articles/how-briefly-losing-her-language-and-memory-liberated-this-neuroanatomist)) The Scaffold Effect Drawing on decades of clinical and personal experience, world-renowned child psychiatrist [Harold Koplewicz, M.D.](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/wc/harold-s-koplewicz-m-d), shares a [smart, comprehensive guide for raising resilient children](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/articles/what-is-scaffolding-parenting-expert-explains-technique). His advice focuses on ways parents can build a solid foundation for kids to grow and develop independence—without overparenting. [The Scaffold Effect: Raising Resilient, Self-Reliant, and Secure Kids in an Age of Anxiety](https://www.amazon.com/Scaffold-Effect-Raising-Resilient-Self-Reliant/dp/0593139348/ref=as_li_qf_sp_asin_il_tl?tag=mind0a3-20) by Harold Koplewicz, M.D. The Pegan Diet In The Pegan Diet, functional medicine doctor and mbg Collective member [Mark Hyman, M.D.](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/wc/dr-mark-hyman), outlines a food-is-medicine approach to nutrition. He takes the best of both Paleo and plant-based eating styles to create a diet that's thoughtfully designed to benefit your body, mind, and the planet. [The Pegan Diet: 21 Practical Principles for Reclaiming Your Health in a Nutritionally Confusing World](https://www.amazon.com/Pegan-Diet-Principles-Reclaiming-Nutritionally/dp/031653708X/ref=as_li_qf_sp_asin_il_tl?tag=mind0a3-20) by Mark Hyman, M.D. (Read an excerpt about the leafy green Hyman wants you to add to your diet, [here.](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/articles/balsamic-roasted-endive)) The Illuminated Breath Breathing is one of the most powerful stress management tools we have at our disposal—not to mention, it's free! In his book The Illuminated Breath, certified yoga instructor [Dylan Werner](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/wc/dylan-werner) shares the histories behind different [breathing practices](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/classes/breathwork?itc_content=43857), and explains how to use them in everyday life to help achieve specific health and wellbeing goals. [The Illuminated Breath](https://www.amazon.com/Illuminated-Breath-Transform-Well-Being-Harnessing/dp/1628604239/ref=as_li_qf_sp_asin_il_tl?tag=mind0a3-20) by Dylan Werner (Read an excerpt on how to do the humming bee breath, [here](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/articles/how-to-do-bhramari-pranayama-the-humming-bee-breath).) Grounded: A Fierce, Feminine Guide to Connecting With the Soil and Healing From the Ground Up If you've read our articles about the [value of soil health](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/articles/broccoli-was-twice-as-nutritious-50-years-agoheres-why) here at mbg, but want a deeper dive on the role it [plays in our own health](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/articles/how-agriculture-depletes-soil-of-minerals-and-what-to-do) and the [health of the planet](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/articles/how-to-support-regenerative-ag-in-light-of-new-rodale-report), pick up a copy of Grounded, written by [ Erin Yu-Juin McMorrow, Ph.D.](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/wc/erin-mcmorrow-phd). In her book, McMorrow explains how to create regenerative systems so that we can become more connected to and help heal the world around us. [Grounded: A Fierce, Feminine Guide to Connecting With the Soil and Healing From the Ground Up](https://www.barnesandnoble.com/w/grounded-erin-yu-juin-mcmorrow/1137482900) by Erin Yu-Juin McMorrow, Ph.D. (Read an excerpt about how to live more regeneratively, [here](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/articles/principles-of-a-regenerative-life).) After: A Doctor Explores What Near-Death Experiences Reveal about Life and Beyond What happens after we die is a question that will be answered many different ways, depending on who you ask and what they believe. If the concept interests you, read [Bruce Greyson, M.D.'s](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/wc/bruce-greyson-m-d) book After, which shares personal accounts of near-death experiences, plus what he's learned in his 50 years of researching the topic. [After: A Doctor Explores What Near-Death Experiences Reveal about Life and Beyond](https://www.amazon.com/After-Doctor-Explores-Near-Death-Experiences/dp/1250263034/ref=as_li_qf_sp_asin_il_tl?tag=mind0a3-20) by Bruce Greyson, M.D. (Read an excerpt about why death might not be so scary after all, [here](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/articles/near-death-experience-lessons).) Unwinding Anxiety: New Science Shows How To Break the Cycles of Worry and Fear To Heal Your Mind As an addiction psychiatrist and neuroscientist, [Judson Brewer, M.D., Ph.D.](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/wc/judson-brewer-m-d-ph-d), understands that anxiety is often the source of unhealthy coping mechanisms. Based on 20 years of research, his book Unwinding Anxiety, details a science-backed approach to break the cycle of worry and fear—which many of us got looped into this past year. [Unwinding Anxiety: New Science Shows How To Break the Cycles of Worry and Fear To Heal Your Mind](https://www.amazon.com/Unwinding-Anxiety-Science-Shows-Cycles/dp/0593330447/ref=as_li_qf_sp_asin_il_tl?tag=mind0a3-20) by Judson Brewer, M.D., Ph.D. (Read an excerpt to find out your behavioral tendencies, [here](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/articles/behavioral-tendencies-quiz).) Set Boundaries, Find Peace: A Guide to Reclaiming Yourself Not being able to leave home throughout the pandemic made setting boundaries with roommates, family, or partners a challenge. And now, as restrictions begin to lift, saying no to social gatherings may present its own challenge. Set Boundaries, Find Peace by licensed therapist [Nedra Glover Tawwab, MSW, LCSW](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/wc/nedra-glover-tawwab) is a masterclass in learning to set and maintain healthy boundaries, without feeling selfish. [Set Boundaries, Find Peace: A Guide to Reclaiming Yourself](https://amazon.com/Set-Boundaries-Find-Peace-Reclaiming/dp/0593192095/ref=as_li_qf_sp_asin_il_tl?tag=mind0a3-20) by Nedra Glover Tawwab, MSW, LCSW (Read an excerpt about the hardest boundary to set, [here.](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/articles/how-to-set-and-actually-honor-time-boundaries-from-therapist)) Sharing The Covers: Every Couple's Guide to Better Sleep Gone are the days where unhappy marriages are defined by whether or not you're sleeping in the same bed (enter: [sleep divorce](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/articles/sleep-divorce)). Clinical psychologist and behavioral sleep specialist, [Wendy Troxel, Ph.D](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/wc/wendy-troxel-ph-d)., understands how valuable good sleep is to overall health and sexual wellness. In her book Sharing the Covers, she helps couples improve their sleep quality, whether or not they're in bed together. [Sharing The Covers: Every Couple's Guide to Better Sleep ](https://www.amazon.com/Sharing-Covers-Every-Couples-Better/dp/0306875004/ref=as_li_qf_sp_asin_il_tl?tag=mind0a3-20)by Wendy Troxel, Ph.D. (Read an excerpt on why most people skip out on sex, [here](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/articles/how-lack-of-sleep-impacts-your-sex-life).) Comparisonitis: How to Stop Comparing Yourself To Others and Be Genuinely Happy In the age of social media, comparison runs rampant. Even when you think you're perfectly content, that photo of a stranger's beach vacation will have you wishing for more time off, a bigger salary, and a cuter bikini. In [Melissa Ambrosini's](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/wc/melissa-ambrosini) book Comparisonitis, she provides practical tips for breaking out of the cycle of comparison so that you can become more confident, creative, and grateful for the life you're living. [Comparisonitis: How to Stop Comparing Yourself To Others and Be Genuinely Happy ](https://www.amazon.com/Comparisonitis-Comparing-Yourself-Others-Genuinely/dp/1950665860/ref=as_li_qf_sp_asin_il_tl?tag=mind0a3-20)by Melissa Ambrosini (Read an excerpt on how to shift your energy when you're struggling with comparison, [here](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/articles/how-to-shift-your-energy-when-you-struggle-with-comparison).) Whole Brain Living: The Anatomy of Choice and the Four Characters That Drive Our Life If you've always believed the brain is divided between a logical left and an emotional right, prepare to have that very same mind blown. In Whole Brain Living, neuroanatomist [Jill Bolte Taylor, Ph.D.,](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/wc/jill-bolte-taylor-ph-d) explains that the two hemispheres have equal parts emotion and logic. Plus, she shares science-backed strategies for optimizing and uniting our brain's four "characters." [Whole Brain Living: The Anatomy of Choice and the Four Characters That Drive Our Life](https://www.amazon.com/Whole-Brain-Living-Anatomy-Characters/dp/1401961983/ref=as_li_qf_sp_asin_il_tl?tag=mind0a3-20) by Jill Bolte Taylor, Ph.D. (Read an excerpt about the 4 ways your brain operates, [here](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/articles/neuroanatomist-on-4-different-ways-your-brain-operates).) Brain Inflamed: Uncovering the Hidden Causes of Anxiety, Depression, and Other Mood Disorders in Adolescents and Teens The isolation, loss, and uncertainty surrounding the pandemic caused many people's mental health to suffer—kids and teens, not excluded. In Brain Inflamed, integrative medicine doctor [Kenneth Bock, M.D. ](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/wc/kenneth-bock-m-d)highlights the rise in mental health disorders among younger populations, along with his theory that inflammation may be the underlying cause, and how to manage the symptoms from a holistic standpoint. [Brain Inflamed: Uncovering the Hidden Causes of Anxiety, Depression, and Other Mood Disorders in Adolescents and Teens](https://www.amazon.com/Brain-Inflamed-Uncovering-Depression-Adolescents/dp/0062970879/ref=as_li_qf_sp_asin_il_tl?tag=mind0a3-20) by Kenneth A. Bock, M.D. (Read an excerpt about why childhood allergies may be on the rise, [here.](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/articles/link-between-mental-health-gut-health-and-childhood-allergies)) Yoke: My Yoga of Self-Acceptance The autobiographical account of Jessamyn Stanley's life in Yoke: My Yoga of Self-Acceptance, explores yoga, not only as a practice, but as a reflection of her celebrations and challenges throughout life. [Yoke: My Yoga of Self-Acceptance](https://www.workman.com/products/yoke) by Jessamyn Stanley (Listen to an excerpt about simplifying your breathwork routine, [here](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/articles/jessamyn-stanley-breathwork).) Nervous Energy: Harness The Power Of Your Anxiety When anxiety is channeled into self-criticism, perfectionism, or OCD tendencies, well, it can certainly impact your well-being. If this sounds like your inclination, we suggest reading psychologist [Chloe Carmichael, Ph.D.'s](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/wc/chloe-carmichael-ph-d) book Nervous Energy, where she shares tips for harnessing that anxious energy in more productive ways.
